fields.summary: Backport 12177 - Setting account address quota causes extra addresses to be allocated.

issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
When the attached quota-address policy with a quota of 2 addresses is uploaded and euca-allocate-address is run 3 times 5 new addresses are allocated and you get the following error

{code}
euca-allocate-address: error (AllocateAddressType): Quota exceeded while trying to create: address by user: arn:aws:euare::000115635237:user/admin
{code} 

Only 2 of the new addresses can be released at that point and the rest must be manually removed from the database using psql.

To Reproduce:
1) euare-accountcreate test-account -wld your-domain-here > test-account.ini 
2) euca-describe-addresses   check for addresses should be none
3) euare-accountuploadpolicy -a test-account -p quota-address-policy -f quota-address  (attached)
4) run euca-allocate-address 3 times and you should see the error described above
6) euca-describe-addresses ( there will be 5 new addresses )
7) try and release the all the new addresses and you will only be able to release 2
8) The remaining addresses will have to be manually removed from the database using psql
fields.summary: Setting account address quota causes extra addresses to be allocated.

I created a separate issue for the 500 error handling. euca2ools retries the 500 error 3 times instead of just returning the error on the first try. TOOLS-629

Code Review Request :

branch : dev-mmunn1-EUCA-12177

diff :  git show --color 2b29a3b6c732c19611731ba5a32bb34066e662cf

Summary: Setting account address quota causes extra addresses to be allocated. When the address is allocated and the quota error is thrown
         Allocator.apply() does not release the newly persisted address.

Solution: add addreeses.release() to Allocator.apply() 


Unit test : described in comments, I have created a Eutester testcase for this issue at: /eutester/testcases/cloud_admin/4-1
[~sjones] Thanks, I will remove the call to input.release( null )

[~kedwards] We would need to provide both the jar with the fix and the psql script to release Addresses that cannot be released with euca-release-address.  Maybe we can get away with just the sql script?

Fix verified:

[root@d-37 spark]# for i in {1..3}; do euca-allocate-address; done;
ADDRESS	10.116.140.80	vpc	eipalloc-0c81ed22
ADDRESS	10.116.140.218	vpc	eipalloc-74012a7e

euca-allocate-address: error (AllocateAddressType): Quota exceeded while trying to create: address by user: arn:aws:euare::000212470003:user/admin

[root@d-37 spark]# euca-describe-addresses 
ADDRESS	10.116.140.80		vpc	eipalloc-0c81ed22			
ADDRESS	10.116.140.218		vpc	eipalloc-74012a7e

[root@d-37 spark]# euca-release-address 10.116.140.80
ADDRESS	10.116.140.80	
[root@d-37 spark]# euca-release-address 10.116.140.218
ADDRESS	10.116.140.218	
[root@d-37 spark]# euca-describe-addresses 
[root@d-37 spark]#
